intro: Phlomoides semnanensis, commonly known as the Semnan phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale blue or purple, arranged in dense spikes, and bloom during the summer months. It is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
